docs.lead_paragraph: Lawyers for J. Crew shareholders have agreed to a settlement in the litigation in Delaware Chancery Court over the $3 billion buyout of the retailer by two private equity firms, TPG Capital and Leonard Green & Partners. Though the settlement does not include a substantial monetary element, it does in some measure cure the process deficiencies in this troubled buyout.

headline.main: J. Crew Buyout Settlement Still Leaves Questions

docs.abstract: The settlement raises a fundamental issue in corporate law: Namely, how should a Delaware court treat a buyer's failure to observe proper process in a buyout, even if the price is arguably fair?
docs.snippet: The settlement raises a fundamental issue in corporate law: Namely, how should a Delaware court treat a buyer's failure to observe proper process in a buyout, even if the price is arguably fair?

docs.lead_paragraph: A child's smile may be priceless, but sometimes it seems that nothing costs more than the braces needed to make that smile well aligned.

headline.main: The Costs of Perfecting a Smile

docs.abstract: In this week's Patient Money column, Walecia Konrad reviews strategies to cope with the cost of braces.
docs.snippet: In this week's Patient Money column, Walecia Konrad reviews strategies to cope with the cost of braces.

docs.lead_paragraph: Now that 2010 is complete, I can see what kind of help Obamacare -- sorry, the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act -- will give me with my health insurance bills. I mentioned in a previous post that my insurance rates for 2011 were a little lower than they had been in 2010 (although I expect them to resume their regular upward march next year). I own a small, struggling manufacturing company that has been providing health care to my people even though it's a stretch. Surely the Affordable Care Act will come to my rescue! But the devil is always in the details, particularly when Congress decides to "help." So the first thing to check: Am I eligible for the tax credit? Here's what I found in the guidelines issued by the Internal Revenue Service:

headline.main: Looking to the Affordable Care Act For Help

docs.abstract: Figuring out if your company qualifies for the tax credit isn't as simple as it sounds.
docs.snippet: Figuring out if your company qualifies for the tax credit isn't as simple as it sounds.

docs.lead_paragraph: Is fear holding you back from a potentially lifesaving screening test?

headline.main: Why People Aren't Screened for Colon Cancer

docs.abstract: Fear was the No. 1 reason older adults gave for not getting a colonoscopy to screen for colon cancer, a new report says.
